page.title: 01West Windsor
page.content: The{Royal town of Windsor}has 31000 inhabitants and is situated in{East {Berkshire}on the{South bank of the {River Thames.}It is bounded on three sides by the river and Royal parkland. The{M4,}just North of Windsor, links Reading, 18 miles to the West and London 23 miles to the East. The town has a long history and developed around the{11th Century {castle.}It attracts up to 3 million visitors per year. This block is situated to the West of the town centre and covers most of Windsor's residential areas and a small section of Crownland. The town could only develop westwards and now includes the once separate villages of{Spital, Clewer and{Dedworth.}Many of the{housing {estates}have been built since the war and contain local shops and schools.
